title: Syntactic Complexity Instructional Design Workshop for Second Language Writing Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic second-language proficiency at CEFR A1 level or higher, understanding fundamental grammar concepts
context.additional_context: Strengthening second language writing instruction competencies within math subject contexts for prospective and practicing teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of three or more task types (explanation, argumentation, description) on syntactic complexity
Learners can analyze CEFR-level syntactic complexity indicators (mean clause length, conjunction frequency, etc.) and apply them to instructional design
Learners can design two or more syntactic complexity training activities implementable in smartphone environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
